alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 07 at 3:43PM MST until February 08 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY CENTRAL IDAHO PANHANDLE MOUNTAINS ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected in Central Idaho Panhandle Mountains above 3500 feet. Additional snow accumulations 10 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Lookout Pass and Dobson Pass. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Motorists should prepare for winter driving conditions with the most significant accumulations tonight. Wednesday morning commute time should expect winter driving conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow accumulations will occur this evening with snowfall rates up to an inch per hour leading to deteriorating travel conditions above 3500 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
